title: Drawing, Design for China Cabinet of Mahogany and Inlay, Sept. 13, 1906, September 13, 1906
title_raw: Design for China Cabinet of Mahogany and Inlay, Sept. 13, 1906
medium: Graphite, red color pencil on thin cream paper
inscribed: Inscribed in red color pencil, upper left corner of sheet: 70; in graphite, lower left  corner of sheet: 1° / T[in circle] Sept. 13, '06; lower right corner: Cabinet / of Mahogany and Inlay; at upper left and right of design: no inlay / inlay [illeg.]; at upper right of sheet: Chas. Cheekey[?] Hyde / Hyde / Mhg-; upper center of design, numerical notations indicating dimensions
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Demi-lune-shaped glass cabinet with flattened center front; molding along top edge; 3 shelves holding china pieces; raised on 4 short tapering legs.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for China Cabinet of Mahogany and Inlay, Sept. 13, 1906, September 13, 1906. Graphite, red color pencil on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-233.
